en: 1795 Sep. 21, Tellico Blockhouse [Territory South of the Ohio River, to] [William] Blount / John McKee

There are two letters. The first letter is from John McKee to Governor William Blount, dated September 21, 1795. McKee confirms sending letters to Cherokee Chiefs and Mr. Dinsmoor as requested by Governor Blount. The second letter is a statement of witness from Silas Dinsmoor and John McKee to Blount, dated October 21, 1795. They confirm that a rifle was given to Willioe in thanks for services rendered to the United States.
Territory of the United States, South of the River Ohio

There are two letters. The first letter is from John McKee to Governor William Blount, dated September 21, 1795. McKee confirms sending letters to Cherokee Chiefs and Mr. Dinsmoor as requested by Governor Blount. The second letter is a statement of witness from Silas Dinsmoor and John McKee to Blount, dated October 21, 1795. They confirm that a rifle was given to Willioe in thanks for services rendered to the United States.

none: 1795 Sep. 21, Tellico Blockhouse [Territory South of the Ohio River, to] [William] Blount / John McKee : page 1

body.value: Tellico Blockhouse Sep September 21st 1795. Sir, In obedience to your instructions I dispatched Willioe & Toonai with Letters for M Dinsmoor the Stallion & to the Chiefs of the Cherokee s from the execution of which they have returned & brought with them three stolen horses which they collected in the Lower Towns. I have the honor to be with respect Your Excellencys Obt Obedient Servant John McKee His Excellency Governor Blount

none: 1795 Sep. 21, Tellico Blockhouse [Territory South of the Ohio River, to] [William] Blount / John McKee : page 2

body.value: We Silas Dinsmoor & John McKee saw delivered by Barclay MGhee to Willioe by Governor Blount's order a new Riffle gun, valued at twenty five Dollars in reward for services rendered the United States by the said Willioe Tellico Blockhouse October 21st 1795 Silas Dinmoor John McKee
